intro: Touchiroa oblonga, commonly known as the narrow-leaved touchiroa, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the daisy family, Asteraceae, and is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and rocky habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It is often found in the lower North Island and parts of the South Island. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
